question: Determine the radian measure of the angle formed by Line_O1_K and Line_L_O1 at O1.
qt_description: Angle K-O1-L by Line_O1_K & Line_L_O1 at O1 (New edges: 1=False, 2=False) (Expr Length: 4)
description:
原始图形描述: Base shape is a regular 5-sided polygon (center O1) with side length 8, rotation angle 0 radians. Total 2 derivation rounds. Round 1: applying 'circum_inscribe' rule. Inscribed 5-sided polygon (center O1). Round 2: applying 'vertex_on_center' rule. Vertex-on-center derivation: 3-gon (center O2) with side length equal to base 5-gon side. Found 14 total points (including intersections). Geometry finalized: 0 new lines and 0 new arcs generated by splitting. Total lines: 13, total arcs: 0, total points: 14.

generated_question: In the given geometric construction, a regular pentagon centered at O1 with side length 8 is inscribed within another regular pentagon (also centered at O1) via a circum-inscribe operation. A second derivation places a triangle centered at O2, with side length equal to that of the base pentagon, such that one of its vertices lies at O1. Point K is a vertex of the inner pentagon, and point L is a vertex of the outer pentagon. Line segments O1K and LO1 are drawn. Determine the radian measure of the angle ∠KO1L formed at vertex O1 by the lines O1K and LO1.
